009package GeometricOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.nonlinear.BilinearMapping2D;
018import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
019import imagingbook.common.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
020import imagingbook.common.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
021
022/**
023 * Demo plugin showing how to specify a bilinear transformation from
024 * a pair of quadrilaterals (point arrays).
025 * Also illustrates the use of {@link ImageMapper}.
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 *
029 * @see AffineMapping2D
030 * @see ImageMapper
031 */
032public class Map_Bilinear implements PlugInFilter {
033
034    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
035        return DOES_ALL;
036    }
037
038    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
039        
040                Pnt2d[] P = {                   // source quadrilateral
041                                PntInt.from(0, 0),
042                                PntInt.from(400, 0),
043                                PntInt.from(400, 400),
044                                PntInt.from(0, 400)
045                };
046
047                Pnt2d[] Q = {           // target quadrilateral
048                                PntInt.from(0, 60),
049                                PntInt.from(400, 20),
050                                PntInt.from(300, 400),
051                                PntInt.from(30, 200)
052                };
053                
054                // we want the inverse mapping (Q -> P, so we swap P/Q):
055                BilinearMapping2D mi = BilinearMapping2D.fromPoints(Q, P);
056                new ImageMapper(mi, OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic).map(ip);
057    }
058}
